overview_of_class:
Solution strategies for traditional word problems and their application to basic chemistry quantitative problems: dimensional analysis, chemical equations, stoichiometry, limiting reagents.

Enrollment only by permission of the Chemistry Department.
Please contact Dr. Fred Northrup at f-northrup@northwestern.edu for more information.
name: Quantitative Problem Solving in Chemistry
title: WCAS CHEM 110-0-01 Quantitative Problem Solving in Chemistry
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Eligibility to enroll in this course is determined by the Initial Chemistry Assessment. View your placement on the Canvas Initial Chemistry Assessment Site under Grades. If you do not see a course placement, please contact chemhelp@northwestern.edu.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Solution strategies for traditional word problems and their application to basic chemistry quantitative problems: dimensional analysis, chemical equations, stoichiometry, limiting reagents.

Enrollment only by permission of the Chemistry Department.
Please contact Dr. Fred Northrup at f-northrup@northwestern.edu for more information.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Enrollment only by permission of the Chemistry Department.
Please contact Dr. Fred Northrup at f-northrup@northwestern.edu for more information.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
1. General Chemistry: Principles and Modern Applications by Petrucci et al., 11th Edition, Pearson, ISBN 9780132931281 ($301.00 new; $225.75 used; $180.99 digital)*

2. Calculations in Chemistry: An Introduction, 2nd Edition, Dahm and Nelson, W.W. Norton, ISBN 9780393284201 ($48.00 new; $36.00 used)*

3. Scientific Calculator, any model (Starting at $10)

*Prices as listed by the Norris Bookstore on 8/24/17. Prices offered by other vendors may be lower.
